title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 400.10 - Representation
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 400.10 - Representation

State Regulations

Any person compelled to appear in person or who voluntarily
appears before the agency shall be accorded the right to be accompanied, represented and advised by counsel. In a proceeding before the agency, every
party or person shall be accorded the right to appear in person or by or with
counsel. Nothing in this section shall be construed either to grant or to deny
to any person who is not a lawyer the right to appear for or represent others
before the agency. In accordance with section
166
of the

Executive Law, any such representative will file a notice of appearance with
the administrative law judge on forms provided by the Department of State and
state whether a fee is being paid therefor. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 19
ยง
400.10

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
